column1: On  the basis  of the aforementioned  evidence itself it is  profusely clear that the  Plaintiff had
no  motive to gift the premises in  suit as  dowry and  it is  manifested that the  Defendant was
only a licensee of the Plaintiff.
I note that the Plaintiff is only asking for a declaration that he is the lawful allottee of the land.
He  is  not claiming a declaration of title.
In  conclusion,  on  the basis  of the  aforementioned  reasons,  I believe  that the  appeal  of the
Defendant must  be  dismissed  with costs. The judgment of the  Learned  District Judge  dated
